resources.string: Everything you need for\nEngg. Subjects at one place
Get Subject wise courses for all semesters
Video Lectures and Notes\nto clear your concepts
Clear your engineering exams with least\namount of time, effort and money spent
Learn from the most structured courses\nprepared by the best teachers
Learn from best teachers\nwith amazing videos and notes
Join our engineering app community of\nmany students and teachers

The principle objective of the Gharda Foundation is To carry on activities for the benefits and development of residents of rural India by application of all suitable means available with focus on issues like health, literacy, non formal education, social awareness, agriculture, technical education etc. on its own or by joining hands or by helping like minded NGO\'s . Establishment of Gharda Institute of Technology in a typical rural sector is also a step in line with the philosophy of Gharda Foundation.\nGIT has provided good infrastucture, modern equipments, advanced laboratories, experienced & dediacated teachers, modified syllabus to suit changing environment, hands on workshop by collaborating with foreign universities and arranging for pre-entrance preparatory workshops.All this provided at a reasonable cost may be with arrangement of loan facilities with subsidized interest rates. Hence the said institute within a couple of years emerged as a premier institute in the eyes of government & businessmen.

string.name: reporting_steps_txt
string.b: To report a bug or problem facing in Git Extc application you must go through the following steps :-

resources.string: (1) Direct reporting a bug or issue is currently not available.\n\n(2) You should take a screenshot of the specific issue (if any) & send a email to our official gmail account.
How long does it take to fix an issue?
(1) The time require to fix an issue depends on the severity of issue.\n\n(2) As soon as the issue (if any) will be fixed we may release a update to our application.
Does Git Extc collects user data while reporting a issue?
(1) Currently you can only view the notes in online mode.\n\n(2) In future you may see the option to download the notes.
